member.summary: Enumeration whose values indicate that no change has taken place.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that an object has been added within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.Update
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that an object has been modified within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that an object has been deleted within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.Rename
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that the leaf in a URL has been renamed.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.MoveAway
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a non-leaf section within a URL has been renamed. The object was moved away from the location within the site specified by the change.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.MoveInto
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a non-leaf section within a URL has been renamed. The object was moved into the location within the site specified by the change.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.Restore
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that an object has restored from a backup or from the recycle bin.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a role definition has been added.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.RoleDelete
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a role definition has been deleted.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.RoleUpdate
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a role definition has been updated.

summary.para: Enumeration whose values specify that a user has been given permissions to a list.
The list must have unique permissions enabled.
Enumeration whose values specify that a user has lost permissions to a list.
The list must have unique permissions enabled.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a user has been added to a group.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.MemberDelete
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a user has been removed from a group.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a change has been made to an item using the SystemUpdate method.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a change in the navigation structure of a site collection has been made.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a change in permissions scope has been made to break inheritance from an object's parent.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ChangeType.ScopeDelete
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that a change in permissions scope has been made to revert back to inheriting permissions from an object's parent.

member.remarks: Enumeration whose values specify that an object has been deleted within the scope of a list content type.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckinType.MinorCheckIn
member.summary: Enumeration whose values are incremented as minor version. The value = 0.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckinType.MajorCheckIn
member.summary: Enumeration whose values are incremented as a major version. The value = 1.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckinType.OverwriteCheckIn
member.summary: Enumeration whose values overwrite the file. The value = 2.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckOutType
member.summary: Enumeration that describes the different checkout states of a file, independent of the lock state of the file. (e.g. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/sharepoint-server/ee538918(v=office.15))

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckOutType.Online
member.summary: The file is checked out for editing on the server.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckOutType.Offline
member.summary: The file is checked out for editing on the local computer.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CheckOutType.None
member.summary: The file is not checked out.

member.summary: Specifies the cache and customization status for a page.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that the page was never cached. The value = 0.

member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that the page is cached and has not been customized. The value = 1.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.CustomizedPageStatus.Customized

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFormatType
member.summary: Specifies the display format for date and time fields. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/sharepoint-csom/ee537367%28v%3doffice.15%29

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFormatType.DateOnly
member.summary: Displays only the date.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFormatType.DateTime
member.summary: Displays the date and time.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFriendlyFormatType
member.summary: Specifies a friendly format to use in displaying date and time fields. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/sharepoint-csom/jj168261%28v%3doffice.15%29

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFriendlyFormatType.Unspecified
member.summary: Undefined. The default rendering will be used. Value = 0.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFriendlyFormatType.Disabled
member.summary: The standard absolute representation will be used. Value = 1.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.DateTimeFieldFriendlyFormatType.Relative
member.summary: The standard friendly relative representation will be used (for example, "today at 3:00 PM"). Value = 2.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldIndexStatus
member.summary: Describes whether a field is indexed, and whether the data in the index is complete

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldIndexStatus.None
member.summary: The field is not indexed.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldIndexStatus.Indexed
member.summary: The field is indexed.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldIndexStatus.Enabling
member.summary: The field index definition has been created, but its data is in the process of being populated.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldIndexStatus.Disabling
member.summary: The field index definition has been deleted, but its data is in the process of being removed.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the field. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/sharepoint-server/ee540543(v=office.15)

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Invalid
member.summary: Must not be used. The value = 0.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Integer
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains an integer value. The value = 1.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Text
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a single line of text. The value = 2.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Note
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains multiple lines of text. The value = 3.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.DateTime
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a date and time value or a date-only value. The value = 4.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Counter
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a monotonically increasing integer. The value = 5.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Choice
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a single value from a set of specified values. The value = 6.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Lookup
member.summary: Specifies that the field is a lookup field. The value = 7.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Boolean
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a Boolean value. The value = 8.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Number
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a floating-point number value. The value = 9.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Currency
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a currency value. The value = 10.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.URL
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a URI and an optional description of the URI. The value = 11.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Computed
member.summary: Specifies that the field is a computed field. The value = 12.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Threading
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates the thread for a discussion item in a threaded view of a discussion board. The value = 13.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Guid
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a GUID value. The value = 14.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.MultiChoice
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains one or more values from a set of specified values. The value = 15.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.GridChoice
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains rating scale values for a survey list. The value = 16.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Calculated
member.summary: Specifies that the field is a calculated field. The value = 17.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.File
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains the leaf name of a document as a value. The value = 18.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Attachments
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates whether the list item has attachments. The value = 19.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.User
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains one or more users and groups as values. The value = 20.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Recurrence
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates whether a meeting in a calendar list recurs. The value = 21.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.CrossProjectLink
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a link between projects in a Meeting Workspace site. The value = 22.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.ModStat
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates moderation status. The value = 23.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.Error
member.summary: Specifies that the type of the field was set to an invalid value. The value = 24.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.ContentTypeId
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains a content type identifier as a value. The value = 25.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.PageSeparator
member.summary: Specifies that the field separates questions in a survey list onto multiple pages. The value = 26.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.ThreadIndex
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates the position of a discussion item in a threaded view of a discussion board. The value = 27.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.WorkflowStatus
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates the status of a workflow instance on a list item. The value = 28.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.AllDayEvent
member.summary: Specifies that the field indicates whether a meeting in a calendar list is an all-day event. The value = 29.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.WorkflowEventType
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains the most recent event in a workflow instance. The value = 30.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FieldType.MaxItems
member.summary: Must not be used. The value = 31.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterLayoutType
member.summary: Available footer layouts for modern sites

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterLayoutType.Simple
member.summary: Simple footer. This is the default layout type with one single row of links. ( Value = 0 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterLayoutType.Extended
member.summary: Extended footer. This layout type supports columns of links with multiple links in each column. ( Value = 1 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterLayoutType.Stacked
member.summary: Stacked footer. This layout type is a combination of simple and extended, with the extended stacked above the simple. ( Value = 2 )

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterVariantThemeType
member.summary: Variants documentation: https://github.com/OfficeDev/office-ui-fabric-react/tree/master/packages/variants Note that this definition is similar to SPVariantThemeType, but with the strong and none variants switched. This is because we want strong to be the default for footer.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterVariantThemeType.Strong
member.summary: strong variant - primary color as background, text uses original background color; white on brand blue by default ( Value = 0 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterVariantThemeType.Neutral
member.summary: neutral variant - light shade of original background as background ( Value = 1 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterVariantThemeType.Soft
member.summary: soft variant - light tint of the primary color as background ( Value = 2 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.FooterVariantThemeType.None
member.summary: no emphasis - appears as normal ( Value = 3 )

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.HeaderLayoutType
member.summary: Available header layouts for modern sites

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.HeaderLayoutType.None

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.HeaderLayoutType.Standard
member.summary: large/standard header ( Value = 1 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.HeaderLayoutType.Compact
member.summary: medium/compact header ( Value = 2 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.HeaderLayoutType.Minimal
member.summary: small/minimal header [not currently used] ( Value = 3 )

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.HeaderLayoutType.Extended
member.summary: extended header ( Value = 4 )

member.summary: No move operation specified. The value = 0.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.PermissionKind.ManageWeb
member.summary: Grant the ability to perform all administration tasks for the Site as well as manage content, activate, deactivate, or edit properties of Site scoped Features through the object model or through the user interface (UI). When granted on the root Site of a Site Collection, activate, deactivate, or edit properties of site collection scoped Features through the object model. To browse to the Site Collection Features page and activate or deactivate Site Collection scoped Features through the UI, you must be a Site Collection administrator.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType
member.summary: RoleType enumeration used in Role Definitions

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.None
member.summary: Enumeration whose values specify that there are no rights on the Web site

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.Guest
member.summary: Has limited rights to view pages and specific page elements. This role is used to give users access to a particular page, list, or item in a list, without granting rights to view the entire site. Users cannot be added explicitly to the Guest role; users who are given access to lists or document libraries by way of per-list permissions are added automatically to the Guest role. The Guest role cannot be customized or deleted.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.Reader
member.summary: Has rights to view items, personalize Web parts, use alerts, and create a top-level Web site using Self-Service Site Creation. A reader can only read a site; the reader cannot add content. When a reader creates a site using Self-Service Site Creation, the reader becomes the site owner and a member of the Administrator role for the new site. This does not affect the user's role membership for any other site. Rights included: CreateSSCSite, ViewListItems, ViewPages.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader rights, plus rights to add items, edit items, delete items, manage list permissions, manage personal views, personalize Web Part Pages, and browse directories. Includes all rights in the Reader role, plus the following: AddDelPrivateWebParts, AddListItems, BrowseDirectories, CreatePersonalGroups, DeleteListItems, EditListItems, ManagePersonalViews, UpdatePersonalWebParts. Contributors cannot create new lists or document libraries, but they can add content to existing lists and document libraries.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Reader rights, plus rights to add items, edit items, delete items, manage list permissions, manage personal views, personalize Web Part Pages, and browse directories. Includes all rights in the Reader role, plus the following: AddDelPrivateWebParts, AddListItems, BrowseDirectories, CreatePersonalGroups, DeleteListItems, EditListItems, ManagePersonalViews, UpdatePersonalWebParts. Contributors cannot create new lists or document libraries, but they can add content to existing lists and document libraries.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.Administrator
member.summary: Has Contributor rights, plus rights to cancel check-out, delete items, manage lists, add and customize pages, define and apply themes and borders, and link style sheets. Includes all rights in the Contributor role, plus the following: AddAndCustomizePages, ApplyStyleSheets, ApplyThemeAndBorder, CancelCheckout, ManageLists. WebDesigners can modify the structure of the site and create new lists or document libraries.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.Editor
member.summary: Has all rights from other roles, plus rights to manage roles and view usage analysis data. Includes all rights in the WebDesigner role, plus the following: ManageListPermissions, ManageRoles, ManageSubwebs, ViewUsageData. The Administrator role cannot be customized or deleted, and must always contain at least one member. Members of the Administrator role always have access to, or can grant themselves access to, any item in the Web site.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.RoleType.Reviewer
member.summary: Has Contributor rights, plus rights to manage lists. Includes all rights in the Contributor role. Editors can create new lists or document libraries.

member.name: M:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.IList.BreakRoleInheritance(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates unique role assignments for the list.
member.param: Specifies whether to copy the role assignments from the parent securable object. If the value is false, the collection of role assignments must contain only 1 role assignment containing the current user after the operation.

If the securable object is a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is true, the role assignments for all child securable objects in the current site and in the sites which inherit role assignments from the current site must be cleared and those securable objects will inherit role assignments from the current site after this call. If the securable object is a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is false, the role assignments for all child securable objects which do not inherit role assignments from their parent object must remain unchanged. If the securable object is not a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is true, the role assignments for all child securable objects must be cleared and those securable objects will inherit role assignments from the current securable object after this call. If the securable object is not a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is false, the role assignments for all child securable objects which do not inherit role assignments from their parent object must remain unchanged.

member.name: M:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.IList.BreakRoleInheritanceAsync(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates unique role assignments for the list.
member.param: Specifies whether to copy the role assignments from the parent securable object. If the value is false, the collection of role assignments must contain only 1 role assignment containing the current user after the operation.

If the securable object is a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is true, the role assignments for all child securable objects in the current site and in the sites which inherit role assignments from the current site must be cleared and those securable objects will inherit role assignments from the current site after this call. If the securable object is a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is false, the role assignments for all child securable objects which do not inherit role assignments from their parent object must remain unchanged. If the securable object is not a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is true, the role assignments for all child securable objects must be cleared and those securable objects will inherit role assignments from the current securable object after this call. If the securable object is not a site, and the clearsubscopes parameter is false, the role assignments for all child securable objects which do not inherit role assignments from their parent object must remain unchanged.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.TermRelationType
member.summary: Type of relationship between two terms

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.TermRelationType.Pin
member.summary: In a pin relationship, a term can be pinned under a different term in a different term set. In a pinned relationship, new children to the term can only be added in the term set in which the term was created. Any change in the hierarchy under the term is reflected across the sets in which the term was pinned.

member.name: F:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.TermRelationType.Reuse
member.summary: The reuse relationship is similar to the pinned relationship except that changes to the reused term can be made from any hierarchy in which the term is reused. Also, a change in hierarchy made to the reused term does not get reflected in the other term sets in which the term is reused.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelation
member.summary:
Represents the relationship between terms in a term store.Currently two types of relationships are supported: pin and reuse.
In a pin relationship, a term can be pinned under a different term in a different term set.In a pinned relationship, new children to the term can only be added in the term set in which the term was created.Any change in the hierarchy under the term is reflected across the sets in which the term was pinned.
The reuse relationship is similar to the pinned relationship except that changes to the reused term can be made from any hierarchy in which the term is reused.Also, a change in hierarchy made to the reused term does not get reflected in the other term sets in which the term is reused.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelation.Id
member.summary: The Unique ID of the term relation.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelation.Relationship
member.summary: The type of relation. Possible values are: pin, reuse.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelation.Set
member.summary: The set in which the relation is relevant.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelation.FromTerm
member.summary: The from term of the relation. The term from which the relationship is defined. A null value would indicate the relation is directly with the set.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelation.ToTerm
member.summary: The to term of the relation. The term to which the realtionship is defined.

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.SharePoint.ITermRelationCollection
member.summary: Collection of terms

member.name: T:PnP.Core.Model.Teams.ITeamChatMessage
member.summary: Represents an individual chat message within a channel or chat. The chat message can be a root chat message or part of a reply thread that is defined by the replyToId property in the chat message.

member.summary: Read-only. Unique Id of the message.

member.summary: Read-only. Id of the parent chat message or root chat message of the thread. (Only applies to chat messages in channels not chats)

member.summary: Read only. Details of the sender of the chat message.

member.summary: Read-only. Version number of the chat message.

member.summary: The type of chat message. The possible values are: message.

member.summary: Read only. Timestamp of when the chat message was created.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.Teams.ITeamChatMessage.LastModifiedDateTime
member.summary: Read only. Timestamp of when the chat message is created or edited, including when a reply is made (if it's a root chat message in a channel) or a reaction is added or removed.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.Teams.ITeamChatMessage.DeletedDateTime
member.summary: Read only. Timestamp at which the chat message was deleted, or null if not deleted.

member.summary: The subject of the chat message, in plaintext.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Model.Teams.ITeamChatMessage.Body
member.summary: Plaintext/HTML representation of the content of the chat message. Representation is specified by the contentType inside the body. The content is always in HTML if the chat message contains a chatMessageMention.

member.summary: URL to a thumbnail image that the channel can use if it supports using an alternative, smaller form of content or contentUrl. For example, if you set contentType to application/word and set contentUrl to the location of the Word document, you might include a thumbnail image that represents the document. The channel could display the thumbnail image instead of the document. When the user clicks the image, the channel would open the document.

member.name: P:PnP.Core.Services.ApiCall.ReceivingProperty
member.summary:
Typically the JSON response will be mapped to the current model object, but sometimes a call will need to be mapped to a specific property in the current model. This for example is done when a property requires it's own Graph Get request.
Current this property is set automatically, no need to manually fiddle with it in API call overrides!
